label: GoogleDrive
description: Arcade.dev LLM tools for Google Drive

tools.name: CreateFolder
tools.description:
Create a new folder in Google Drive.

By default, parent folder paths are resolved in My Drive. For shared drives, use folder IDs
or provide shared_drive_id.

parameters.name: folder_name
parameters.description: The name of the new folder to create

parameters.name: parent_folder_path_or_id
parameters.description: The parent folder path like folder/subfolder or folder ID where to create. If None, creates at the root of My Drive. If providing a path, it will be resolved within My Drive by default. Do not include the folder to create in this path. Defaults to None.

parameters.name: shared_drive_id
parameters.description: If creating in a shared drive and using a parent folder path, provide the shared drive ID. Not needed when using folder IDs or creating in My Drive. Defaults to None.

output.description: Created folder information including ID, name, web view link, and location path

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DownloadFile
tools.description:
Download a blob file (non-workspace file) from Google Drive as base64 encoded content.

For small files (under ~5MB raw), returns the file content directly in the response as base64.
For large files, returns metadata with requires_chunked_download=True - use download_file_chunk
to retrieve the file in parts.

By default, paths are resolved in My Drive. For shared drives, use file IDs or provide
shared_drive_id.

parameters.name: file_path_or_id
parameters.description: The file path like folder/subfolder/filename or the file ID of the file to download Folders NOT supported. If providing a path, it will be resolved within 'My Drive' by default.

parameters.name: shared_drive_id
parameters.description: If the file is in a shared drive and using a path, provide the shared drive ID. Not needed when using file IDs. Defaults to None (uses 'My Drive').

output.description: For small files (<5MB): file content (base64 encoded) and metadata. For large files: metadata with requires_chunked_download=True and instructions.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: DownloadFileChunk
tools.description:
Download a specific byte range of a file from Google Drive.

Use this for large files that require chunked download (when download_file returns
requires_chunked_download=True). Call repeatedly with increasing start_byte values
to retrieve the complete file.

Returns the chunk content as base64, along with progress information including
whether this is the final chunk.

parameters.name: file_path_or_id
parameters.description: The file path like folder/subfolder/filename or the file ID to download a chunk from. If providing a path, it will be resolved within 'My Drive' by default.

parameters.name: start_byte
parameters.description: The starting byte position for this chunk (0-indexed).

parameters.name: chunk_size
parameters.description: The size of the chunk to download in bytes. Max 5MB (5242880). Defaults to 5MB (5242880).

parameters.name: shared_drive_id
parameters.description: If the file is in a shared drive and using a path, provide the shared drive ID. Not needed when using file IDs. Defaults to None (uses 'My Drive').

output.description: Chunk content (base64 encoded), byte range info, and progress details

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GenerateGoogleFilePickerUrl
tools.description:
Generate a Google File Picker URL for user-driven file selection and authorization.

This tool generates a URL that directs the end-user to a Google File Picker interface where
where they can select or upload Google Drive files. Users can grant permission to access their
Drive files, providing a secure and authorized way to interact with their files.

This is particularly useful when prior tools (e.g., those accessing or modifying
Google Docs, Google Sheets, etc.) encountered failures due to file non-existence
(Requested entity was not found) or permission errors. Once the user completes the file
picker flow, the prior tool can be retried.

Suggest this tool to users when they are surprised or confused that the file they are
searching for or attempting to access cannot be found.

output.description: Google File Picker URL for user file selection and permission granting

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetFileTreeStructure
tools.description:
Get the file/folder tree structure of the user's entire Google Drive.
Very inefficient for large drives. Use with caution.

parameters.name: include_shared_drives
parameters.description: Whether to include shared drives in the file tree structure. Defaults to False.

parameters.name: restrict_to_shared_drive_id
parameters.description: If provided, only include files from this shared drive in the file tree structure. Defaults to None, which will include files and folders from all drives.

parameters.name: include_organization_domain_documents
parameters.description: Whether to include documents from the organization's domain. This is applicable to admin users who have permissions to view organization-wide documents in a Google Workspace account. Defaults to False.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Sort order. Defaults to listing the most recently modified documents first

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of files and folders to list. Defaults to None, which will list all files and folders.

output.description: A dictionary containing the file/folder tree structure in the user's Google Drive

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: MoveFile
tools.description:
Move a file or folder to a different folder within the same Google Drive.

Can move to a folder (keeping name), or move and rename in one operation. By default, paths
are resolved in My Drive. For shared drives, use file IDs or provide shared_drive_id.

parameters.name: source_file_path_or_id
parameters.description: The source file path like folder/subfolder/filename or the file ID of the file to move. If providing a path, it will be resolved within 'My Drive' by default.

parameters.name: destination_folder_path_or_id
parameters.description: The path to the file's parent folder (exclude the file to be moved) or parent folder ID to move the file into. If None, moves to the root of the drive. Defaults to None.

parameters.name: new_filename
parameters.description: Optional new name for the file after moving. If None, keeps the original name. Defaults to None.

parameters.name: shared_drive_id
parameters.description: If working with paths in a shared drive, provide the shared drive ID. Not needed when using IDs. Defaults to None (uses My Drive).

output.description: Confirmation with the file's ID, name, and new location

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: RenameFile
tools.description:
Rename a file or folder in Google Drive.

By default, paths are resolved in My Drive. For files in shared drives, either use the file ID
directly or provide the shared_drive_id parameter.

parameters.name: file_path_or_id
parameters.description: The path like folder/subfolder/filename or the file ID to rename. If providing a path, it will be resolved within 'My Drive' by default.

parameters.name: new_filename
parameters.description: The new name for the file

parameters.name: shared_drive_id
parameters.description: If the file is in a shared drive and you're using a path (not ID), provide the shared drive ID to resolve the path within that drive. Not needed when using file IDs. Defaults to None (searches 'My Drive').

output.description: Confirmation with the file's new name, ID, and web view link

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: SearchFiles
tools.description:
Search for files in Google Drive.

The provided 'query' should only contain the search terms.
The tool will construct the full search query for you.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The exact search query to send to the Google Drive API to find files in Google Drive. The tool will construct the query for you. Will search for filenames and file contents that match the provided query.

parameters.name: folder_path_or_id
parameters.description: Search only within this specific folder. Provide either a path like folder/subfolder or a folder ID. If None, searches across all accessible locations. Defaults to None.

parameters.name: shared_drive_id
parameters.description: If provided, search only within this shared drive. Defaults to None (searches My Drive and optionally all shared drives).

parameters.name: include_shared_drives
parameters.description: If True and shared_drive_id is not set, include all shared drives in search. Defaults to False (My Drive only).

parameters.name: include_organization_domain_documents
parameters.description: Whether to include documents from the organization's domain. This is applicable to admin users who have permissions to view organization-wide documents in a Google Workspace account. Defaults to False.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Sort order for search results. Defaults to listing the most recently modified documents first. If the query contains 'fullText', then the order_by will be ignored.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of search results to return. Defaults to 50.

parameters.name: file_types
parameters.description: Filter by specific file types. Defaults to None, which includes all file types.

output.description: Search results containing matching files from Google Drive with metadata and file information

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ShareFile
tools.description:
Share a file or folder in Google Drive with specific people by granting them permissions.

If a user already has permission on the file, their role will be updated to the new role.
By default, paths are resolved in My Drive. For shared drives, use file IDs or provide
shared_drive_id.

parameters.name: file_path_or_id
parameters.description: The file path like folder/subfolder/filename or the file ID to share. If providing a path, it will be resolved within My Drive by default.

parameters.name: email_addresses
parameters.description: List of email addresses like user@domain.com to share with

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: The permission role to grant. Defaults to reader (view-only).

parameters.name: send_notification_email
parameters.description: Whether to send an email notification to the recipients. Defaults to True.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Optional message to include in the notification email. Defaults to None.

parameters.name: shared_drive_id
parameters.description: If the file is in a shared drive and using a path, provide the shared drive ID. Not needed when using file IDs. Defaults to None (uses My Drive).

output.description: Sharing confirmation with list of granted permissions including recipient emails and roles

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UploadFile
tools.description:
Upload a file to Google Drive from a URL.

Fetches the file content from the provided URL and uploads it to Google Drive.
Supports files of any size - uses resumable upload internally for large files.

CANNOT upload Google Workspace files (Google Docs, Sheets, Slides)
CANNOT upload files larger than 25MB

parameters.name: file_name
parameters.description: The name for the uploaded file

parameters.name: source_url
parameters.description: The public download URL to fetch the file content from. The tool will download from this URL and upload to Google Drive

parameters.name: mime_type
parameters.description: The file type. If not provided, will be inferred from the URL or Content-Type header. Supported: text (txt, csv, json, html, md), pdf, images (png, jpeg, gif). Defaults to None (auto-detect).

parameters.name: destination_folder_path_or_id
parameters.description: The folder path like folder/subfolder or folder ID where to upload. If None, uploads to the root of 'My Drive'. If providing a path, it will be resolved within 'My Drive' by default. Defaults to None.

parameters.name: shared_drive_id
parameters.description: If uploading to a folder in a shared drive using a path, provide the shared drive ID. Not needed when using folder IDs or uploading to My Drive. Defaults to None ('My Drive')

output.description: Uploaded file information including ID, name, web view link, and location

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: WhoAmI
tools.description:
Get comprehensive user profile and Google Drive environment information.

This tool provides detailed information about the authenticated user including
their name, email, profile picture, Google Drive storage information, the shared
drives (and their IDs) the user has access to, and other
important profile details from Google services.

output.description: Get comprehensive user profile and Google Drive environment information.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

summary:
Arcade.dev provides a toolkit for integrating with Google Drive, enabling seamless file management and user authentication. This toolkit allows developers to efficiently manage and interact with files and folders in Google Drive through a variety of LLM tools that streamline operations.

**Capabilities**
- Create, move, rename, and manage files and folders in Google Drive.
- Upload, download, and share files securely with granular permissions.
- Search for files and retrieve the complete file tree structure.
- Generate a Google File Picker URL for user-driven file selection.

**OAuth**
Provider: Google
Scopes: https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.file, https://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.email, https://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.profile
